RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 1 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 76. Maiden Special Weight Purse 38000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPICY ITALIAN pressed the pace while racing in hand to the second turn, assumed command, drew clear and held safely under mild urging. LIL CARRIE D went four wide on the turns, stalked the pace, bid five wgide entering the stretch, couldn't gain late and finished second best. PACIFIC VIEW pressed the pace along the rail, fell back into the turn, came again between horses, didn't have enough late and settled for show. WICKED SKY showed speed to the second turn and flattened out. VOSTRA was never far back, swung wide entering the stretch, had nothing left for the drive and fell back. BORDER STAR set a pressured pace to the second turn, tired and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Border Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace to 2nd turn, tired, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Spicy Italian
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed in hand, took command 2nd turn, drew clear, mild urging

ENTRY.NAME: Pacific View
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed rail, fell back, came again between horses, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Wicked Sky
ENTRY.OWNER: Warchol Thoroughbreds LLC Warchol Dennis and Warchol Jerome
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed to 2nd turn, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Lil Carrie D
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4wide turns, stalked pace, 5wide bid, couldn't gain, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Vostra
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, swung wide entering stretch, nothing left

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Special Weight Purse 38000. FOR ILLINOIS REGISTERED, CONCEIVED AND/OR FOALED. Maidens, Three Years Old and Upward. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Rail at 10 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EL MUCHO set a pressured pace and drew off in the drive under mild urging. SMOOTH ATTACK got away well, pressed the pace along the rail, bid willingly, was no match for the winner and all out for place. J J'S SOLUTION trailed the field, angled out on the turn, bid eight wide, closed well and was gaining for second. FLYING CRICKET crowded start, stalked the pace towards the outside, rallied four wide on the turn, swung wide, had little left and dropped back. GOD GUNS N GUTS saved ground, bid along the rail on the turn and came up empty. PONCHO ATTACK was crowded at the start, pressed the pace, bid between horses on the turn, tired and faded through the stretch. LONE RETURN broke slowly and failed to threaten in an even effort. JAKES CHANNEL came in at the start, raced mid pack, dropped inside on the turn and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Smooth Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed pace rail, no match for winner, held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: J J's Solution
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, angled out turn, 8wide bid, closed, gaining for place

ENTRY.NAME: God Guns N Guts
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, bid rail turn, came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: El Mucho
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, drew off in drive, mild urging, best

ENTRY.NAME: Poncho Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: crowded start, bid between horses turn, tired, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Flying Cricket
ENTRY.COMMENT: crowded start, stalked outside, rallied 4wide turn, little left

ENTRY.NAME: Jakes Channel
ENTRY.COMMENT: came in start, mid pack, dropped inside turn, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Lone Return
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke slowly, even effort, failed to threaten

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 3 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 74. Maiden Special Weight Purse 38000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MERLOTTI broke in, stalked the pace while racing in hand, challenged two across on the turn, dueled to mid stretch and drew off. MINING CAMP set a pressured pace, responded when challenged on the turn to duel, was no match late and finished second best. ANCIENT MAN was never far back, saved ground to the second turn, shifted out, offered a mild bid and got up for show. BLACK RAVEN was never far back, rallied on the turn, had little left for the drive and was outfinished for third.

ENTRY.NAME: Ancient Man
ENTRY.OWNER: Ramos Jorge and Sanchez Jose A
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground to 2nd turn, fell back, angled out, mild bid,up show

ENTRY.NAME: Mining Camp
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace to 2nd turn, responded to duel, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Merlotti
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked in hand, challenged turn, dueled, drew off, best

ENTRY.NAME: Black Raven
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, rallied turn, little left, hung late, caught 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 13500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HANDSOFFTHEGOODS hesitated and bumped at the start, rallied four wide on the turn, bid willingly, dueled for the lead and inched clear late in a game effort. XPRESSIR set the pace, responded when challenged to duel and yielded late to finish second best. CHERRY ORCHARD angled out on the turn, bid five wide, was in tight in the upper stretch and finished well to earn show. JACKPOT BOY veered in and bumped at the start, was unhurried early, raced outside, bid six wide, was in tight in the upper stretch and had little left. HOT CUPPA COFFEE pressed the pace, bid between horses to the turn, fell back and gave way. ONE ACE pressed the pace along the inside, bid along the rail on the turn and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Cherry Orchard
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled out turn, 5wide bid, finished well, earned show

ENTRY.NAME: One Ace
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside, bid rail turn, came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Handsoffthegoods
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, bid 4wide turn, bid willingly, dueled, clear late

ENTRY.NAME: Jackpot Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in, bumped,unhurried, raced outside, 6wide bid, little left

ENTRY.NAME: Xpressir
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, responded to duel, yielded late, grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Hot Cuppa Coffee
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, bid between horses turn, fell back, gave way,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Outbound Ike H. HAWTHORNE RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 107. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS AND UPWARD. No nomination fee. Nominees to pay $300 to pass the entry box and an additional $450 to start, with $75,000 guaranteed to be divided 60 percent to the winning owner, 20 percent to second, 10 percent to third, 5 percent to fourth, 3 percent to fifth and 2 percent divided equally among the remaining finishers. earnings (according to Equibase). Starters to be named through the entry box by the usual time of closing. Trophy to the winning owner. Nominations closed Augu st 3, 2023 with 24. In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and One-Sixteenth on the main track. (Rail at 10 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOTARY was unhurried early, saved ground, rallied into the turn, angled out, assumed command three across and drew off in the drive while kept to task. BUCK MOON vied inside to the second turn, fell back and was no match for the winner. GREY STREAK vied two across to the second turn, fell back, drifted out late and held for show. READTHECLIFFNOTES was unhurried early, rallied into the turn, bid five wide, closed well and didn't have enough late. SONNY SMACK lagged early, raced outside, rallied into the turn, bid six wide, had nothing left and was not urged late.

ENTRY.NAME: Notary
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, rallied into turn, angled out, took over, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Readthecliffnotes
ENTRY.OWNER: Cherrywood Racing II and Donohoe Laura
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, rallied into turn, 5wide bid, closed, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Sonny Smack
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged outside, rallied into turn, 6w bid, empty, not urged late

ENTRY.NAME: Buck Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied inside to 2nd turn, fell back, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Grey Streak
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 2across to 2nd turn, fell back, drifted out late, held show

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 20000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Claiming races for $17,500 or less not considered in es timating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SALLY'S SUPRISE stalked the pace while racing outside, rallied into the turn, closed steadily and wore down her rivals to get up in the final strides. CRYSTAL SNOW moved up to vie two across to mid stretch, inched clear and was caught near the wire. SEQUAYA was unhurried early, saved ground, bid inside and got up for show. PRIMITY rallied inside on the turn, angled out for the drive and lacked the needed late response. HEAVENLY SCENT led early, vied inside to mid stretch, faltered and lost position. MAZLAN showed speed to the turn, gave way, was eased and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Heavenly Scent
ENTRY.COMMENT: led early, vied inside to mid stretch, faltered, lost position

ENTRY.NAME: Sequaya
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, saved ground, bid inside, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Crystal Snow
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 2across to mid stretch, inched clear, caught near wire

ENTRY.NAME: Primity
ENTRY.COMMENT: rallied inside turn, angled out for drive, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: Mazlan
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed to turn, gave way, eased, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Sally's Suprise
ENTRY.COMMENT: close outside, bid turn, steady close, wore down rivals, up late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 7 5F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 41000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $40,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Claiming races for $25,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at Five Fur longs on the main track. (Rail at 10 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FIRST KITTEN broke out, lagged early while racing outside, went six wide leaving the turn, closed with a rush, got up late and won going away. RACEDAY ATTIRE dropped inside entering the turn, bid along the rail entering the stretch, closed steadily and got up for place while no threat to the winner. MISS MELODY set the pace, drew off on the turn for a clear lead, led to late stretch, was outclosed and safe for show. GOLDEN BELL raced close to the pace, went five wide leaving the turn and lacked a late response. LIPLINER chased the pace, bid, came up empty and failed to menace. CHROME ATTACK was outrun in an even effort. JUST A WONDER saved ground, was through early and failed to threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Melody
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, drew off, clear lead, led late, outclosed

ENTRY.NAME: Lipliner
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, bid, empty, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Just a Wonder
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, through early, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Bell
ENTRY.COMMENT: close to pace, bid 5wide leaving turn, lacked late response

ENTRY.NAME: Chrome Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: even effort, no threat, outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Raceday Attire
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped inside into turn, bid rail, steady close, up for place,

ENTRY.NAME: First Kitten
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, lagged outside, 6wide bid, up late, going away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 8 6F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 41000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $10,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $40,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners o f a race since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (Claiming races for $25,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHITE LIES broke out, raced mid pack, bid inside on the turn, closed steadily, got up late and was all out at the wire. ALBERTA SUN was away alertly, pressed the pace early, fell back, went five wide leaving the turn, closed willingly and was gaining late. SOMEONE SAID SO set the pace, drew off on the turn for a clear lead, faltered late and held for show. SAY CHEESE was crowded at the start, raced close to the pace, bid six wide, closed well and didn't have enough late. CHAMPAGNE AFFAIR was void of early speed, went widest in the drive and finished well. BERAVINA broke in the air to be off slowly, raced wide and lacked the needed late response. RONAN was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Ronan
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor, outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Champagne Affair
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, widest in drive, finished well,

ENTRY.NAME: Beravina
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in air, off slowly, raced wide, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: White Lies
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, bid inside turn, steady close, up late, all out

ENTRY.NAME: Alberta Sun
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed early, fell back, 5w bid, closed, gaining

ENTRY.NAME: Someone Said So
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, drew off turn, clear lead, faltered late, held show

ENTRY.NAME: Say Cheese
ENTRY.OWNER: McDonnell Bernard P and McDonnell Myles D
ENTRY.COMMENT: crowded start, close to pace, 6wide bid, closed, not enough
